Title: Show HN: I made a website that makes you cry - Hacker News
Author: 
Published Date: 2025-07-28T00:19:37.000Z
URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=44705960
Text: | | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| | | Hi everyone! Thank you so much for your appreciation for the site (except that one guy who hated it). Pretty awesome to see this little side project make it to the front page on here. I'm working on a new project called Feel ( [https://www.feelapp.io](https://www.feelapp.io)) which is an app that helps you feel all emotions on demand. It goes beyond just crying and helps you navigate and shift your mood in real time. It can make you cry too though. Or feel joy, awe, confidence, serenity, or even process difficult emotions like anger or fear when you need to. This isn't an ad or shameless plug I promise - I'm actually looking for a creative developer to join the team and help us take it to the next level. Please reach out if this resonates with you or share with your creative coder

Title: How Awe Will Transform Your Life
Author: 
Published Date: 2025-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
URL: https://www.nosmallendeavor.com/dacher-keltner-awe
Text: - [Home](https://www.nosmallendeavor.com/home)
- [Episodes](https://www.nosmallendeavor.com/episodes)
- [Dacher Keltner: How Awe Will Transform Your Life](https://www.nosmallendeavor.com/dacher-keltner-awe)

## “Brief doses…help your heart, your immune system, your stress, your reasoning, your relationships,"

says psychologist and bestselling author Dacher Keltner. And believe it or not, he's not describing some new miracle drug or medical treatment.

He’s talking about the experience of awe.

He defines awe as “the feeling we have when we encounter vast, mysterious things.” It’s something we all have experienced, but often talk about rather sheepishly. Dacher has spent considerable time seeking it out and studying it, and the results are in. In this episode, he shares his findings, and offers all the ways in which awe is a necessary

Title: 4 Apps That Have Changed My Life - Life Well Wandered
Author: almathews
Published Date: 2019-02-12T01:32:15.000Z
URL: https://lifewellwandered.com/apps-changed-life/
Text: It seems kind of silly to acknowledge that an app has changed my life. After all, it’s a little square that I tap on my phone that opens up a program. How special could one of those be? Very special, it turns out. Given the fact that I have anxiety, I’m highly introverted, and I generally go through a lot of life struggles, apps on my phone have made help easy to access and impossible to ignore (no matter how hard I try). Hopefully, the below apps can help you, whether you’re struggling with something or just want to improve your life. Headspace Probably one of the best-known apps out there on meditation and mindfulness, Headspace needs no introduction. I’ve been using Headspace on and off since 2015 (definitely more off than on). It’s been there for me during my worst bouts of anxiety and self-doubt and is

Title: 11 Life-Changing Apps That Made Me Calmer, Happier, and More ...
Author: Utsuk Agarwal
Published Date: 2025-07-26T22:24:54.000Z
URL: https://medium.com/illumination/11-life-changing-apps-that-made-me-calmer-happier-and-more-focused-03dcaca6d797
Text: Zoom image will be displayed

Photo by [Andy Makely](https://unsplash.com/@rendermouse?utm_source=medium&utm_medium=referral) on [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=medium&utm_medium=referral)

> We are not merely distracted; we indeed experience digital exhaustion.

I was not burned out with my work. I was burned out on the online existence-the constant noise, pressure to “optimize” every second, never-ending chase for balance that doesn’t truly exist.

Then I decided to do the radically contrary: I stopped blaming tech and started curating it.

I built a personal toolkit — 11 apps that, rather than just helping me stay organized, actually taught me to calm down: lower heart rate, better sleep, better boundaries, less doo
